_exec_summary.SummaryText:
In the event of an an emergency requiring assistance,
it is the policy to notify the Scottsville Fire Department and request assistance. Other agencies may be 
brought into play on an as needed basis. This policy and chemical storage volumes as well as locations
have been covered with local emergency providers.

Facility Descriptionand Regulated Substance:
This facility manufactures textile material which is supplied to other facilities for use in tire manufacturing.
Formaldehyde (37% solution) is an ingredient in a textile treatment dip solution which is applied to a woven
fabric. The formaldehyde process consists of one 5000 gallon storage tank and associated equipment which
are located inside the manufacturing building.

Prevention and Emergency Response Policy
This facility compies with 29 CFR 1910.119 (OSHA's Process Safety Management Rule) and it is our
policy to adhere to all aplicable federal, state, and local laws. If an emergency involving Formaldehyde was
to occur, it is our policy to notify the Scottsville Fire Department if outside assistance is necessary.

Worst Case Release Scenario
The worst case release scenario is the release of the entire formaldehyde storage container. In this 
scenario, the release would be mitigated by the surrounding dyke and the building. Using EPA's RMP
Comp program, we determined that under these conditions, the distance to the toxic endpoint would be 
0.10 miles. Since the toxic endpoint is very limited due to preventive measures that have been installed, 
even this worst case scenario would not effect nearby public receptors

Prevention Program
This facility complies with EPA's Risk Management Rule and OSHA's Process Safety Management 
Rule. Additionally the storage tank and process are located inside the building to prevent releases to the
environment. The process is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with OSHA's PSM and good 
engineering practices.

Five Year Accident History
This facility has never had an accident involving Formaldehyde that caused deaths, injuries, property,
or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.

Emergency Response Program
This facility has a spill prevention and response procedure in place which includes employee training
and coordination with local emergency response.
